resource_dependency.authAPI: API endpoints for user registration, login, logout, and session validation.
resource_dependency.userSchema: Database table: users(id UUID PRIMARY KEY, email VARCHAR(255) UNIQUE, password_hash TEXT, created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT NOW(), updated_at TIMESTAMP).

function: Enable user registration and secure authentication with session management.
static_description: A centered form with fields for email, password, confirm password, and a forest green submit button on an ivory background.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking the submit button sends credentials to the authAPI for processing. Displays success message or errors based on response.
Pressing Enter while focused on any input field triggers form submission.

resource_dependency.profileEditAPI: API endpoint for updating user profile information including file uploads.
resource_dependency.photoUploadAPI: API endpoint specifically for uploading profile images.
resource_dependency.profileSchema: Database table: profiles(user_id UUID REFERENCES users(id), full_name TEXT, phone_number TEXT, skills TEXT[], qualifications TEXT, photo_url TEXT, updated_at TIMESTAMP).

function: Allow users to create and update their personal and professional details along with uploading a profile picture.
static_description: Form containing text inputs for name, phone number, email (read-only), multi-select dropdown for skills, textarea for qualifications, image preview area, and a forest green save button on an ivory background.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking save submits data via profileEditAPI. Clicking upload triggers photo selection dialog and sends selected image to photoUploadAPI.
Changing selections in skill dropdown updates internal state before saving.

resource_dependency.jobPostAPI: API endpoints for creating, reading, updating, and deleting job listings.
resource_dependency.employerDashboardAPI: API endpoints to fetch employer-specific job posts and related applications.
resource_dependency.jobSchema: Database tables: jobs(id UUID PRIMARY KEY, title TEXT, description TEXT, category_id INT REFERENCES categories(id), location TEXT, wage_range TEXT, posted_by UUID REFERENCES users(id), created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT NOW()), categories(id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, name TEXT UNIQUE).

function: Provide tools for employers to create and manage job postings including title, description, category, location, and wage range.
static_description: Form with input fields for job title, category dropdown, location textbox, wage range selector, rich-text editor for description, and a forest green publish button on an ivory background.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking publish submits the form to jobPostAPI. Category dropdown shows options fetched from categories table.
Selecting a different category updates the formâ€™s internal value before submission.

resource_dependency.searchJobsAPI: API endpoint that supports filtering by category, keyword, location, wage, etc.
resource_dependency.categoryListAPI: API endpoint returning list of available job categories.
resource_dependency.categoriesSchema: Database table: categories(id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, name TEXT UNIQUE).

function: Allow job seekers to filter job listings by predefined categories such as construction, plumbing, electrical work, etc.
static_description: Sidebar or top bar filters with checkboxes/dropdowns for each category (fetched dynamically), search box, and a forest green apply filters button on an ivory background.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking apply filters sends selected criteria to searchJobsAPI and refreshes job results.
Selecting/unselecting filter items updates active filters list.

resource_dependency.browseJobsAPI: Paginated or scroll-based API endpoint for fetching job listings.
resource_dependency.jobsSchema: Database table: jobs(id UUID PRIMARY KEY, title TEXT, description TEXT, category_id INT REFERENCES categories(id), location TEXT, wage_range TEXT, posted_by UUID REFERENCES users(id), created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT NOW()).

function: Display a list of available jobs with pagination or infinite scrolling mechanism.
static_description: Grid or list layout showing job cards with title, short description, category badge, location, wage range, and a forest green apply now button per card on an ivory background.

interaction_and_states.description: Reaching bottom of page triggers loading next batch of jobs if using infinite scroll.
Clicking a job card navigates to detailed job view. Clicking 'apply now' redirects to application form.

resource_dependency.applicationSubmitAPI: API endpoint for submitting job applications.
resource_dependency.applicationsSchema: Database table: applications(id UUID PRIMARY KEY, job_id UUID REFERENCES jobs(id), applicant_id UUID REFERENCES users(id), status TEXT CHECK(status IN ('pending', 'reviewed', 'accepted', 'rejected')) DEFAULT 'pending', submitted_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT NOW()).

function: Enable candidates to apply for jobs and track the status of those applications.
static_description: Modal or dedicated page displaying job details followed by a forest green apply button. Confirmation screen appears after successful submission on an ivory background.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking apply opens confirmation prompt then submits through applicationSubmitAPI. Shows success/error feedback.

resource_dependency.employerDashboardAPI: API endpoints for retrieving employer's posted jobs and associated applications.
resource_dependency.jobSchema: Database table: jobs(id UUID PRIMARY KEY, title TEXT, description TEXT, category_id INT REFERENCES categories(id), location TEXT, wage_range TEXT, posted_by UUID REFERENCES users(id), created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT NOW()).

function: Provide employers with a centralized interface to view, edit, delete job posts and review incoming applications.
static_description: Tabbed interface with sections for 'My Jobs' and 'Applications'. Job cards show title, applicants count, and actions like edit/delete. Application lists show candidate names, applied date, and status toggles on an ivory background.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking tabs switches views. Clicking edit/delete modifies/deletes job entry via employerDashboardAPI. Status toggle changes application statuses.

resource_dependency.candidateDashboardAPI: API endpoints for retrieving candidate's profile and application history.
resource_dependency.applicationsSchema: Database table: applications(id UUID PRIMARY KEY, job_id UUID REFERENCES jobs(id), applicant_id UUID REFERENCES users(id), status TEXT CHECK(status IN ('pending', 'reviewed', 'accepted', 'rejected')) DEFAULT 'pending', submitted_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT NOW()).

function: Offer candidates access to manage their profile and monitor the progress of their job applications.
static_description: Split-screen layout with left panel showing profile summary and right panel listing past applications with titles, dates, and current statuses on an ivory background.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking 'edit profile' navigates to profile editor. Clicking individual applications reveals more details.

resource_dependency.databaseSetupInstructions: Initialize PostgreSQL database using DB_HOST=localhost, DB_PORT=5432, DB_USERNAME=myappuser, DB_PASSWORD=myapppassword, DB_NAME=myapp. Create tables: users, profiles, jobs, applications, categories with defined relationships.

function: Define relational structure for storing user accounts, profiles, job listings, job applications, and job categories.
static_description: No visible UI element; this defines underlying data structures referenced throughout the app.

resource_dependency.apiEndpointSpecs: Defined routes under /api/v1/: auth (register/login), profile (get/update), jobs (list/create/update/delete), applications (submit/list/update)

function: Expose RESTful services enabling frontend components to interact with backend logic securely.
static_description: No visible UI element; specifies how frontend communicates with backend systems.

resource_dependency.colorPalette: #FFFFF0 for ivory background, #228B22 for forest green buttons and links

function: Apply consistent color scheme across entire platform using specified ivory and forest green tones.
static_description: All pages feature ivory (#FFFFF0) backgrounds and forest green (#228B22) accents for buttons, links, and interactive controls.

interaction_and_states.description: Forest green buttons darken slightly when hovered over.

resource_dependency.responsiveFramework: Use CSS media queries and flexible grid layouts to adapt content to various screen sizes.

function: Ensure optimal viewing experience on both desktop and mobile devices without horizontal scrolling or misaligned elements.
static_description: Layout adjusts fluidly between desktop-wide columns and stacked mobile rows depending on viewport size.

interaction_and_states.description: UI reflows automatically to fit smaller screens, collapsing sidebars into hamburger menus where appropriate.

resource_dependency.fileUploadService: Integration point for handling multipart/form-data uploads for profile pictures.

function: Allow users to upload and store profile photographs within the system.
static_description: Image uploader widget with drag-and-drop zone or standard file browser trigger inside profile form.

interaction_and_states.description: Dragging an image onto the drop zone highlights it and initiates upload upon release.
Clicking the upload area opens native file picker. Selected files are sent to fileUploadService.

resource_dependency.validationLibrary: Client-side library for validating form inputs before sending to server.
resource_dependency.errorHandlingMiddleware: Server-side middleware returning structured error messages.

function: Prevent invalid submissions and provide clear guidance when corrections are needed.
static_description: Inline red error labels appear beneath improperly filled fields during real-time validation.

interaction_and_states.description: Leaving a field triggers immediate validation check and displays relevant error if found.
Submitting forms triggers full validation suite; failed checks prevent request and highlight issues.

resource_dependency.packageJsonConfig: { "scripts": { "install:all": "cd frontend && npm install && cd ../backend && npm install", "dev": "concurrently \"cd frontend && npm start\" \"cd backend && npm run dev\"" } }

function: Streamline local development workflow with unified installation and startup commands.
static_description: Root-level package.json script definitions allowing developers to use npm run install:all and npm run dev.
